dcterms:description: CFQ (Compositional Freebase Questions) is a realistic semantic parsing benchmark to measure compositional generalization. The task is to parse a natural language query into a query in SPARQL, with a focus on maximizing the divergence of compound structures.
dcterms:title: CFQ (Compositional Freebase Questions)

dcterms:creator: Brenden M. Lake
Marco Baroni
dcterms:description: SCAN is an instruction following task where the goal is to map natural language instructions to action sequences. The dataset is designed to evaluate compositional generalization in models.
dcterms:title: SCAN

dcterms:creator: John M. Zelle
Raymond J. Mooney
dcterms:description: GeoQuery is a text-to-SQL dataset that focuses on translating natural language queries into SQL queries. The template split ensures that train and test splits do not share SQL templates, which is crucial for evaluating generalization.
dcterms:title: GeoQuery
